releases.details: Released as Doctor Who: Carnival of Monsters.
special_features: Commentary by Katy Manning and Barry Letts
Model Sequences - The Original 16mm Visual Effects Tests
Trailer - The Five Faces of Doctor Who

releases.details: Released as Doctor Who: Carnival of Monsters.

notes: This is the first story featuring the term Tellurian to mean human being.
Originally titled Peepshow; the title was changed due to potential lewd connotations.
The Drashigs were named as an anagram of 'dish rag'.

real_world_cultural_references: Major Daly tries to engage the Doctor in games of bridge and mahjong.
Claire Daly recalls seeing the musical play Lady, Be Good.

continuity_notes: Vorg mentions that Ogrons are sometimes used as servants by the Daleks.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor and Jo arrive on the SS Bernice, where they discover they are inside a miniscope controlled by the alien Vorg. A series of strange occurrences take place showcasing various miniature environments.
Vorg demonstrates the miniscope's capabilities to the tribunal while the Doctor and Jo attempt to escape from the SS Bernice as they are pursued by Drashigs.
As the Doctor and Jo navigate the dangers of the miniscope, they learn more about its functions and the threat from the Drashigs increases, leading to chaos outside the machine.

The Doctor confronts the officials of Inter Minor while trying to free the beings trapped within the miniscope. The climax comes when the Drashigs escape and wreak havoc, ultimately resolved through the intervention of Vorg.
